programmes.show_description: Beauty clinic owner Michelle and her friend Liz swap with unemployed single mum Amy and daughter Phoebe as they find how work and confidence can triumph over mental health issues.
A hard-up trio of friends are treated like royalty at a prestigious chateau in France, swapping with two pals who exchange their five-star hotels for a no-frills Norfolk campsite.
Rob Bell explores the history and engineering behind Britain's Greatest Bridges. A look at the Britannia Bridge. (Ep 1)
A daily round-up of showbiz news and gossip from around the world, focusing on celebrities, movies, music and entertainment.

A holiday in Honolulu brings another case when the political rivalry of two brothers ends in murder.
When a newspaper columnist becomes the target of a crazed gunman, Jessica's advice to be careful is ignored.
In a friend's apartment, Jessica and her friends are amused and then puzzled by the strange drama unfolding on TV.
While Jessica is on holiday in Martinique, an old friend is accused of murder.
Two people are murdered in a brutal fashion at a winery in Sonoma Valley that is struggling to make ends meet.
Jessica investigates the suspicious deaths of two Cabot Cove locals.
Jessica is among a number of authors booked to appear on a television show when an infomercial audience member is found dead and she takes on the case.
While attending a book fair in Miami, Jessica Fletcher forms a new and unlikely alliance with a Russian detective to solve a mystery surrounding art theft.
Jessica Fletcher helps Seth solve a problem within the family after his cousin, an expert on plants, gets in a heated argument over a newly-developed tree.
Jessica comes to give aid to a good friend who is somehow involved in the theft of a priceless Egyptian artifact.
A deserted Spanish town scarred by its brutal wartime past, a ghostly fleet of ships, and a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest are all investigated to uncover why they were abandoned.

programmes.show_name: New: Battlefront: WWII Road to Victory
programmes.show_description: The Allies launch an ill-fated attack on the German-occupied port of Dieppe, France, where the Nazis proved to be too strong.

programmes.show_name: New: Battlefront: WWII Road to Victory
programmes.show_description: At the Battle of Stalingrad, the besieged Soviet Red Army turned the tables on the German Army.
On 1st September 1939, 1.5 million German soldiers poured into Poland, beginning the countdown to the 2nd World War. JJ Chalmers and Raksha Dave tell the dramatic story. (Ep1)
JJ Chalmers and Raksha Dave explore 2nd September 1939, as Germany's invasion of Poland escalates. RAF recruits deploy, London hospitals are emptied and Parliament braces for war. (Ep2)
On 3rd September 1939, Britain declared war. After a tense ultimatum and false alarm, British planes saw their first action and the SS Athenia was torpedoed, marking the first casualties. (Ep3)
Gritty drama series set in a women's prison in Melbourne. While Bea is held in the psychiatric unit, Franky is pushed to reveal her biggest secret to Bridget.
Drama series. Doreen goes into labour after being attacked. Bea learns the story of Jianna. Vera confronts Ferguson about the riot. Fletch recognises Bea's abductor.
Drama series. After her meltdown, a merciless Ferguson is out for vengeance and Jodie, Doreen, Nash and Bridget are the casualties.
Drama series. After Kim plants drugs in her cell, Franky is forced to put her life in jeopardy or ruin her chances of parole. Will finally learns who killed his wife.

Rob Bell looks at James Cook's Endeavour. King George III commanded Cook to locate a mysterious continent in the South Pacific. To do so, Endeavour would have to sail quite off the map.
Exploring the history of British ships that changed the world. The Queen Mary began as a floating gentlemen's club, and became a WWII legend even Hitler feared.
Presenter Rob Bell explores the history of British ships that changed the world. The Mayflower overcame almost impossible odds to establish the colony that became USA.
Rob Bell explores how Discovery's bold journey to Antarctica propelled Scott and Shackleton into the ranks of the world's most famous explorers.
Crime drama starring Peter Falk and Oskar Werner. The rumpled detective plays a cat-and-mouse game with a hi-tech killer who has just murdered his mother-in-law. (1975)

programmes.show_name: Columbo: Requiem for a Falling Star
programmes.show_description: Detective drama starring Peter Falk and Anne Baxter. A feud between a fading actress and a gossip columnist forms the backdrop to a homicide investigation. (1973)
Murder mystery starring Peter Falk and Dick Van Dyke. A photographer shoots his wife and stages the evidence to make the murder look like a fatal abduction. (1974)
The unorthodox detective is assigned to a case in which a young chemist is murdered and the formula for a revolutionary beauty cream is stolen. (1973)
A desperate woman in love murders her own brother to gain control of the family business. (1971)
Ainsley Harriott narrates a collection of less than "Chef's kiss" moments from some of the nation's best-loved cookery TV shows, including Masterchef and Saturday Kitchen.
The chief suspect in a murder has the perfect alibi, but DCI Taggart is convinced he is guilty. Meanwhile, DS Jardine investigates escalating racial attacks at a block of flats.
